channel.title: Grabbing Images from A File [VB]
channel.description:
*I am using Microsoft Visual Basic 2005 Express Edition
Okay. I got to the point where I could View & Edit text documents, and now all I want to do is grab images from a file and be able to edit them, and re-save them. Why? Because I'm making a hacking tool for a game. If you could help, that'd be great :D
~Lin

item.title: Grabbing Images from A File [VB]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:29, topic:136783”]Before you begin extracting sprites from a gameboy rom, you need to learn the format of one first.
simply using the vb api’s image io functions wont cut it, you will have to skip along the rom’s actual instructions before you get to the sprites. Even then, it’s probably easier reading them with your own method.[/quote]Yeah I’m going to GBA instead, and I’ve already got the compresses data offsets, and all I need to do is display them.

Read full topic

item.title: Grabbing Images from A File [VB]
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Before you begin extracting sprites from a gameboy rom, you need to learn the format of one first.
simply using the vb api’s image io functions wont cut it, you will have to skip along the rom’s actual instructions before you get to the sprites. Even then, it’s probably easier reading them with your own method.

Read full topic

item.title: Grabbing Images from A File [VB]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[code] '// Opening \

    Dim dImage As Drawing.Image
    dImage = dImage.FromFile(YOURPATH)[/code]

[code] '// Saving \

dImage.Save(YOURPATH, Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.EXTENTION)[/code]

http://vb-helper.com/howto_net_savepicture.html

Easy enough for you to save the picture, just save it where the other one is. It will overwrite it.

Never messed with any .gbc ROMs before, so I’ll download a few, and take a look in a minute.

-Mh

Read full topic

All you know is how to batch script and make a private server.
I’ve seen you program Java, you’re truly pathetic.
I’d give it up as all you do is make your self look worse and worse.
And you’re attitude and intelligence clearly gives away that you’re 11.
[/quote]aww can’t type “ECHO” on the keyboard and also i have a very low imagination so most of my programs don’t trun out good till i get a "Burst of imagination " so stfu so can you type atleast 10 words per hour?[/quote]

BAHAHA epic fail.
Alos, you’re Java fundamentals could use a lot of work, you program like pizza pie does.

Stop spamming my topic please

Ok sorry.

[quote=“remove_later, post:18, topic:136783”][quote author=LoveScaper link=topic=188319.msg1701305#msg1701305 date=1188075127]
pretty easy (cause im a vbmaster almost!) but for the noobs, this should help

now, make it load a file from the internet
[/quote]
No you are not.
Monster Hack > you * 99999999[/quote]Well LoveScaper helped me with my Save As, so he’s good just because of that lol

And overwrite meaning overwrite what it used to be, update the picture.

Again, I’ll try and explain what I want.

Open a ROM, a .gbc rom

Be able to select images from them

Edit the image using a tileset

Save it to the rom so the room I edited is what I edited to

^^

Read full topic
